intro: Homalanthus alpinus, commonly known as the alpine homalanthus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing adaptations to cold and harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss in arid, high-altitude climates. The flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to yellow, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
